Subject: RE: File updates - Product Master

 

Hi Jo,

 

Thanks for the product master files.

As we discussed yesterday, we understand that, in the new product codification logic, you would be including the complete ‘customer code’ as part of the product number. And also, as mentioned, once we create the product codes/customer codes, we cannot change the codes (though description can be changed). The revised product master data that you provided now has the old (existing) customer codes embedded in the product codes. Since, going forward these customer numbers would change (numeric codes), creating these product codes might not be useful (except where we have new customer codes embedded in the product codes).

Hence, the product codes that we would be creating should have the actual customer numbers added in those. Hence, is it possible to identify such products that are customer specific and those that are generic. We can create the generic products and hold

Cc: Umang Trivedi <Umang.Trivedi@percipere.co <mailto:Umang.Trivedi@percipere.co> >; Hariom Soni <hariom.soni@percipere.co <mailto:hariom.soni@percipere.co> >; Shruti Joshi <shruti.joshi@percipere.co <mailto:shruti.joshi@percipere.co> >; Daniel Spencer <daniel.spencer@percipere.co <mailto:daniel.spencer@percipere.co> >; Sankalp Ambade <sankalp.ambade@percipere.co <mailto:sankalp.ambade@percipere.co> >; Vivek Chaphekar <vivek.chaphekar@percipere.co <mailto:vivek.chaphekar@percipere.co> >; Sankalp Kallianpur <sankalp.kallianpur@percipere.co <mailto:sankalp.kallianpur@percipere.co> >; Sampada Vanjare <sampada.vanjare@percipere.co <mailto:sampada.vanjare@percipere.co> >
Subject: RE: File updates - Product Master

 

Hi Jo,

 

Thanks for the product master files.

As we discussed yesterday, we understand that, in the new product codification logic, you would be including the complete ‘customer code’ as part of the product number. And also, as mentioned, once we create the product codes/customer codes, we cannot change the codes (though description can be changed). The revised product master data that you provided now has the old (existing) customer codes embedded in the product codes. Since, going forward these customer numbers would change (numeric codes), creating these product codes might not be useful (except where we have new customer codes embedded in the product codes).

Hence, the product codes that we would be creating should have the actual customer numbers added in those. Hence, is it possible to identify such products that are customer specific and those that are generic. We can create the generic products and hold on the customer specific once. Please let me know your thoughts in this.

 

@Jason Martin <mailto:jason.martin@nikwax.co.uk>  – Considering the above approach for customers and products, is it a good idea to have the separate number ranges for suppliers (say 2 series) to have a clear demarcation between the customer numbers and supplier numbers? I have checked internally, this wouldn’t have any impact from system perspective. Please let me know if you have any suggestions on this.

 

Thanks

Abhay Patil

Subject: RE: File updates - Product Master

 

Hi Jo,

 

Thanks for the product master files.

As we discussed yesterday, we understand that, in the new product codification logic, you would be including the complete ‘customer code’ as part of the product number. And also, as mentioned, once we create the product codes/customer codes, we cannot change the codes (though description can be changed). The revised product master data that you provided now has the old (existing) customer codes embedded in the product codes. Since, going forward these customer numbers would change (numeric codes), creating these product codes might not be useful (except where we have new customer codes embedded in the product codes).

Hence, the product codes that we would be creating should have the actual customer numbers added in those. Hence, is it possible to identify such products that are customer specific and those that are generic. We can create the generic products and hold on the customer specific once. Please let me know your thoughts in this.

 

@Jason Martin <mailto:jason.martin@nikwax.co.uk>  – Considering the above approach for customers and products, is it a good idea to have the separate number ranges for suppliers (say 2 series) to have a clear demarcation between the customer numbers and supplier numbers? I have checked internally, this wouldn’t have any impact from system perspective. Please let me know if you have any suggestions on this.

 

Thanks

Abhay Patil

Hi Abhay,

From: Abhay Patil <abhay.patil@percipere.co> 
Sent: 25 July 2025 13:48
To: Jo Jones <jo.jones@nikwax.co.uk>; Julian Gaskin <julian.gaskin@nikwax.co.uk>; Jason Martin <jason.martin@nikwax.co.uk>
Cc: Umang Trivedi <Umang.Trivedi@percipere.co>; Hariom Soni <hariom.soni@percipere.co>; Shruti Joshi <shruti.joshi@percipere.co>; Daniel Spencer <daniel.spencer@percipere.co>; Sankalp Ambade <sankalp.ambade@percipere.co>; Vivek Chaphekar <vivek.chaphekar@percipere.co>; Sankalp Kallianpur <sankalp.kallianpur@percipere.co>; Sampada Vanjare <sampada.vanjare@percipere.co>
Subject: RE: File updates - Product Master

 

Hi Jo,

 

Thanks for the product master files.

As we discussed yesterday, we understand that, in the new product codification logic, you would be including the complete ‘customer code’ as part of the product number. And also, as mentioned, once we create the product codes/customer codes, we cannot change the codes (though description can be changed). The revised product master data that you provided now has the old (existing) customer codes embedded in the product codes. Since, going forward these customer numbers would change (numeric codes), creating these product codes might not be useful (except where we have new customer codes embedded in the product codes).

Hence, the product codes that we would be creating should have the actual customer numbers added in those. Hence, is it possible to identify such products that are customer specific and those that are generic. We can create the generic products and hold on the customer specific once. Please let me know your thoughts in this.

 

@Jason Martin <mailto:jason.martin@nikwax.co.uk>  – Considering the above approach for customers and products, is it a good idea to have the separate number ranges for suppliers (say 2 series) to have a clear demarcation between the customer numbers and supplier numbers? I have checked internally, this wouldn’t have any impact from system perspective. Please let me know if you have any suggestions on this.

 

Thanks

Abhay Patil

Subject: Product Master - 23/05

 

Hello Team,

 

Greetings for the day.

 

I have reviewed the product master file and can say that quality of the data received is really good and most of the corrections highlighted in our previous review have been addressed.


I understand that the current file pertains to Nikwax products from HQ, and that data from other entities will be provided separately in due course.

 

Please find below a summary of observations, clarifications, and actions required for both Nikwax and Paramo product masters also the correction which are completed by me for the initial load:

 

Nikwax Product Master

 

*	Language Setting: Language has been set to EN – this has been corrected.

 

*	Material Prefixes D000 and DN: Please confirm if these are raw materials used in production. Additionally, IBCs are assumed to be semi-finished goods – kindly confirm. 

 

*	Product Type (FMHI): Some items are currently classified as FMHI, but there is uncertainty regarding whether these are production tools or packaging materials. For example, CAP (AB00437PR, AB00434PR) and Bottle (AB00562HR, AB00630R) - Please advise.

 

*	Marketing Materials (M_ items): Are these intended to be stock-managed? They are currently managed through the warehouse. If these are non-stock items, they should not be included under warehouse management as they are marked NLAG - Please confirm.

 

*	Material 1S0440GBSTANDARD: This item is currently assigned product type NLAG. Kindly confirm if this is intended to be a non-stock item.

 

*	Weights Verification: Please reconfirm the weights for the following materials: AB00141, 2701GBSTANDARD, AB00139, AB00140W, and AB00150.

 

*	Transportation Group: All materials are currently assigned Transportation Group – 0001. This has been corrected.

 

*	MRP for Marketing Materials: Marketing materials are currently set up to run MRP in the Plant data. Please confirm if this is the intended setup.

 

*	Plant Assignment for Raw Materials (D0000 series): If these materials are confirmed as raw materials, they should be procured to the Manufacturing Plant (GN01). Accordingly, their assignment should be changed from GN02 to GN01 – Action required.

 

*	Sales Text File Extension: Materials need to be extended in the sales text file to allow for descriptions exceeding 40 characters. This change will be handled by Percipere during the initial load – Action required.

 

*	Valuation Data: The standard price is missing in the valuation data s

From: Kate Thompson <kate.thompson@nikwax.co.uk>
Sent: Tuesday, May 27, 2025 5:02 PM
To: Umang Trivedi <Umang.Trivedi@percipere.co>
Cc: Jo Jones <Jo.Jones@nikwax.co.uk>; Julian Gaskin <Julian.Gaskin@nikwax.co.uk>; John Arnold <John.Arnold@nikwax.co.uk>
Subject: FW: Product Master - 23/05 
 

Hi Umang,

 

John has been through the Warehouse points, please see below

 

*                     Incorrect Assignment of Raw Materials in FP01 (Warehouse Sheet): Some raw materials are currently maintained in both the "Warehouse Product" and "Warehouse Product Storage Type" views for warehouse FP01. However, these materials should not be assigned to warehouse FP01, as they are not warehouse-managed. For example, materials in the D000... series fall under this category and should be excluded - D codes removed

 

*                     Putaway Control for IBC and Semi-Finished Materials (Warehouse Sheet):

For IBC and semi-finished materials that are procured from the manufacturing plant, putaway will be done directly in the GR (Goods Receipt) Area. Therefore, it is recommended to set the Putaway Control Indicator field to ZGRA (GR-Area) in the “Warehouse Product Sheet.” This setting will ensure that the system directs putaway to occur within the GR area itself. ZGRA doesn’t exist on the drop down menu and it will not let me overtype this field.  Please can you amend this your side?

 

*                     Storage Section and Dummy Bin Configuration (Warehouse Sheet):

As we are assigning the storage section as General for all products, we will need to create a few dummy bins under Storage Type ZG01 and Storage Section ZGEN. When putaway tasks are generated, the system will propose these bins in the General storage section. However, warehouse operators will perform the actual putaway based on operational convenience and bin availability. – Okay 

 

 

Thanks

Kate

To: Umang Trivedi <umang.trivedi@percipere.co>

The last three points regarding the warehouse I need to talk with John about and get back to you.

 

Thanks

Kate

 

From: Umang Trivedi <Umang.Trivedi@percipere.co <mailto:Umang.Trivedi@percipere.co> > 
Sent: 26 May 2025 09:30
To: Julian Gaskin <julian.gaskin@nikwax.co.uk <mailto:julian.gaskin@nikwax.co.uk> >; Jo Jones <jo.jones@nikwax.co.uk <mailto:jo.jones@nikwax.co.uk> >
Cc: Jason Martin <jason.martin@nikwax.co.uk <mailto:jason.martin@nikwax.co.uk> >; Abhay Patil <abhay.patil@percipere.co <mailto:abhay.patil@percipere.co> >; Sampada Vanjare <sampada.vanjare@percipere.co <mailto:sampada.vanjare@percipere.co> >; Vivek Chaphekar <vivek.chaphekar@percipere.co <mailto:vivek.chaphekar@percipere.co> >; Robert Starling <robert.starling@percipere.co <mailto:robert.starling@percipere.co> >
Subject: Product Master - 23/05

 

Hello Team,

 

Greetings for the day.

 

I have reviewed the product master file and can say that quality of the data received is really good and most of the corrections highlighted in our previous review have been addressed.


I understand that the current file pertains to Nikwax products from HQ, and that data from other entities will be provided separately in due course.

 

Please find below a summary of observations, clarifications, and actions required for both Nikwax and Paramo product masters also the correction which are completed by me for the initial load:

 

Nikwax Product Master

 

*	Language Setting: Language has been set to EN – this has been corrected.

 

*	Material Prefixes D000 and DN: Please confirm if these are raw materials used in production. Additionally, IBCs are assumed to be semi-finished goods – kindly confirm. Yes that’s fine

 

*	Product Type (FMHI):Basic Data, Column B Some items are currently classified as FMHI, but there is uncertainty regarding whether these are production tools or packaging materials. For example, CAP (AB00437PR, AB00434PR) and Bottle (AB00562HR, AB00630R) - Please advise. – these are the bottles, caps and that the product is filled into, so we put them as Production Resource FHMI, should they be Packaging materials VERP in SAP?

 

*	Marketing Materials (M_ items): Are these intended to be stock-managed? They are currently managed through the warehouse. If these are non-stock items, they should not be included under warehouse management as they are marked NLAG - Please confirm. These are marketing materials

 

*	Material 1S0440GBSTANDARD: This item is currently assigned product type NLAG. Kindly confirm if this is intended to be a non-stock item. – no this an error , it is finished goods

 

*	Weights Verification: Please reconfirm the weights for the following materials: AB00141, 2701GBSTANDARD, AB00139, AB00140W, and AB00150. – requested the weights – will update once I have it

 

*	Transportation Group: All materials are currently assigned Transportation Group – 0001. This has been corrected.

 

*	MRP for Marketing Materials: Marketing materials are currently set up to run MRP in the Plant data. Please confirm if this is the intended setup. – yes – marketing finished products need to be manufactured but not brochures – so I should remove these form the Plant data sheet altogether?

 

*	Plant Assignment for Raw Materials (D0000 series): If these materials are confirmed as raw materials, they should be procured to the Manufacturing Plant (GN01). Accordingly, their assignment should be changed from GN02 to GN01 – Action required. – we will amend to GN01

 

*	Sales Text File Extension: Materials need to be extended in the sales text file to allow for descriptions exceeding 40 characters. This change will be handled by Percipere during the initial load – Action required. – okay thanks

 

*	Valuation Data: The standard price is missing in the valuation data sheet – Action required. – we aren’t using Moving average price so this is not needed

 

*                     Incorrect Assignment of Raw Materials in FP01 (Warehouse Sheet): Some raw materials are currently maintained in both the "Warehouse Product" and "Warehouse Product Storage Type" views for warehouse FP01. However, these materials should not be assigned to warehouse FP01, as they are not warehouse-managed. For example, materials in the D000... series fall under this category and should be excluded - D codes removed

 

*                     Putaway Control for IBC and Semi-Finished Materials (Warehouse Sheet):

For IBC and semi-finished materials that are procured from the manufacturing plant, putaway will be done directly in the GR (Goods Receipt) Area. Therefore, it is recommended to set the Putaway Control Indicator field to ZGRA (GR-Area) in the “Warehouse Product Sheet.” This setting will ensure that the system directs putaway to occur within the GR area itself. ZGRA doesn’t exist on the drop down menu and it will not let me overtype this field.  Please can you amend this your side?

 

*                     Storage Section and Dummy Bin Configuration (Warehouse Sheet):

As we are assigning the storage section as General for all products, we will need to create a few dummy bins under Storage Type ZG01 and Storage Section ZGEN. When putaway tasks are generated, the system will propose these bins in the General storage section. However, warehouse operators will perform the actual putaway based on operational convenience and bin availability. – Okay 

 

 

Paramo Product Master

 

*	Language Setting: Language has been set to EN – this has been

Hi Hariom,

 

As discussed yesterday , we will select ZG01 in storage type and GENERAL in storage sections for all lines. This is with the understanding, that yesterday ,you confirmed that we can change the storage type and storage section before we do the final upload.

 

Product Number*

A key that uniquely identifies the product.

Type: Text
Length: 80

Warehouse Number*

Specifies an alphanumeric key that identifies a complex, physical warehouse within the Warehouse Management system.
All activities within a warehouse, for example, goods movements and physical inventory, are assigned to a specific warehouse number. The physical warehouse where these activities take place is identified by the warehouse number.

Type: Text
Length: 80

Party Entitled to Dispose*

Specifies the organization, defined as a business partner, that is entitled to dispose of stock. Usually this is the plant in which the stock is planned, and in which the ATP check is performed. For each plant, there is exactly one partner master record with plant assignment in the vendor partner role.

Type: Text
Length: 80

Storage Type*

Specifies a subdivision of a complex, physical warehouse. Different storage types are identified by their warehousing technique, form of organization, or their function.

Type: Text
Length: 80

Storage Section Indicator

Specifies in which storage section the product is to be put away.

Type: Text
Length: 80

Hi Hariom,

 

As discussed yesterday , we will select ZG01 in storage type and GENERAL in storage sections for all lines. This is with the understanding, that yesterday ,you confirmed that we can change the storage type and storage section before we do the final upload.

 

Product Number*

A key that uniquely identifies the product.

Type: Text
Length: 80

Warehouse Number*

Specifies an alphanumeric key that identifies a complex, physical warehouse within the Warehouse Management system.
All activities within a warehouse, for example, goods movements and physical inventory, are assigned to a specific warehouse number. The physical warehouse where these activities take place is identified by the warehouse number.

Type: Text
Length: 80

Party Entitled to Dispose*

Specifies the organization, defined as a business partner, that is entitled to dispose of stock. Usually this is the plant in which the stock is planned, and in which the ATP check is performed. For each plant, there is exactly one partner master record with plant assignment in the vendor partner role.

Type: Text
Length: 80

Storage Type*

Specifies a subdivision of a complex, physical warehouse. Different storage types are identified by their warehousing technique, form of organization, or their function.

Type: Text
Length: 80

Storage Section Indicator

Specifies in which storage section the product is to be put away.

Type: Text
Length: 80

Subject: RE: SAP Product Master

 

Good afternoon Hariom,

 

Can answer about the Páramo products but for the Nikwax ones you’d need to contact Kate and Mick if you haven’t already.

 

*	NAUV1J13E can be deleted as that doesn’t exist so was likely an input error

 

For the questions about storage types and sections that are not present in the master file, we probably need to talk further so we understand what we’ve missed.

 

When are you free?

 

Kind regards

Marc

Subject: SAP Product Master

 

Good afternoon, 

 

From the Product master file, I have certain observations regarding the Warehouse extension for the products:

*	There are certain products which are present in Warehouse Stock (Template 5 in WM) but not present in the Product Master file, these are listed in the file attached to the mail.
*	The warehouse extension seems incomplete for both Paramo and Nikwax, not all Storage types and sections are present. 

 

If there is need for any discussion with me or Sankalp Kallianpur, please let us know. 

 

Thanks, and Regards,


          

Hariom Soni

Associate Consultant

Hello, sorry for the delay. In the Product master template for Paramo, there are many rows (Product) which are incomplete, seems like it is yet to filled. Also, there are other Storage types like GI, GR Area, Clarification area they need to fill.
For Nikwax, They have completed only 2 Storage types, i.e. ZBLK and ZPAL, but as per Sankalp it should be ZG01 and there are other Storage types they have to fill as well.

If @Sankalp Kallianpur <mailto:sankalp.kallianpur@percipere.co>  agree with this observations I’ll mail this to Marc (Paramo) and John (Nikwax)
